superclasses.name: Heteroatom Alkylation and Arylation
superclasses.description: Reactions involving the formation of bonds between heteroatoms and carbon atoms

classes.name: N-alkylation
classes.description: Formation of bonds between nitrogen atoms and alkyl groups

classes.name: O-alkylation
classes.description: Formation of bonds between oxygen atoms and alkyl groups

classes.name: S-alkylation
classes.description: Formation of bonds between sulfur atoms and alkyl groups

classes.name: N-arylation
classes.description: Formation of bonds between nitrogen atoms and aryl groups (Buchwald-Hartwig)

classes.name: O-arylation
classes.description: Formation of bonds between oxygen atoms and aryl groups

classes.name: Williamson ether synthesis
classes.description: Formation of ethers via nucleophilic substitution of alkyl halides with alkoxides

superclasses.name: Acylation and Related Processes
superclasses.description: Reactions involving the introduction of acyl groups (R-C=O) into molecules

classes.name: N-acylation
classes.description: Formation of bonds between nitrogen atoms and acyl groups

classes.name: O-acylation
classes.description: Formation of bonds between oxygen atoms and acyl groups

classes.name: Friedel-Crafts acylation
classes.description: Electrophilic aromatic substitution with acyl groups

classes.name: Esterification
classes.description: Formation of esters from carboxylic acids and alcohols

classes.name: Amide formation
classes.description: Formation of amides from carboxylic acids or derivatives and amines

classes.name: Acid chloride formation
classes.description: Formation of acyl chlorides from carboxylic acids

superclasses.name: Deprotections
superclasses.description: Removal of a protecting group for a molecule

classes.name: Amine deprotection
classes.description: Removal of a protecting group for an amine

classes.name: Alcohol deprotection
classes.description: Removal of a protecting group for an alcohol

classes.name: Carboxylic acid deprotection
classes.description: Removal of a protecting group for a carboxylic acid

classes.name: Carbonyl deprotection
classes.description: Removal of a protecting group for a carbonyl group

classes.name: Hydrogenolysis
classes.description: Removal of a protecting group by hydrogenolysis

classes.name: Aldol condensation
classes.description: Two carbonyl moieties (of aldehydes or ketones) react to form a β-hydroxyaldehyde or β-hydroxyketone (an aldol reaction), and this is then followed by dehydration to give a conjugated enone

classes.name: Suzuki coupling
classes.description: Palladium-catalyzed cross-coupling reaction of organoboronic acids or esters with organic halides to form a new carbon-carbon bond

classes.name: Grignard reaction
classes.description: Nucleophilic addition reaction where an organomagnesium halide (Grignard reagent (RMgX)) reacts with a carbonyl to form a new carbon-carbon bond, resulting in the formation of an alcohol

classes.name: Diels-Alder reaction
classes.description: [4+2] cycloaddition reaction in which a conjugated diene reacts with a dienophile to form a six-membered ring

classes.name: Michael addition
classes.description: Nucleophilic addition reaction where a nucleophile (Michael donor) attacks the β-carbon of an α,β-unsaturated carbonyl compound (Michael acceptor), forming a new carbon-carbon bond

classes.name: Wittig reaction
classes.description: Reaction that converts aldehydes and ketones into alkenes using a phosphonium ylide (Wittig reagent), forming carbon-carbon double bonds

classes.name: Heck reaction
classes.description: Reaction of an unsaturated halide (or triflate) with an alkene in the presence of a base and a palladium catalyst to form a substituted alkene

classes.name: Cross coupling reactions
classes.description: Reactions where two different fragments are joined

classes.name: Alcohol to alkyl halide
classes.description: Conversion of an alcohol to an alkyl halide

classes.name: Acid to ester
classes.description: Conversion of an acid to an ester

classes.name: Ester to acid
classes.description: Conversion of an ester to an acid

classes.name: Alkene to alkane
classes.description: Conversion of an alkene to an alkane

classes.name: Ketone to alcohol
classes.description: Conversion of a ketone to an alcohol

classes.name: Nitrile to amine
classes.description: Conversion of a nitrile to an amine

classes.name: Carbonyl reduction
classes.description: Reduction of a carbonyl group

classes.name: Nitro reduction
classes.description: Reduction of a nitro group

classes.name: Alkene reduction
classes.description: Reduction of an alkene to an alkane

classes.name: Nitrile reduction
classes.description: Reduction of a nitrile to an amine

classes.name: Ester reduction
classes.description: Reduction of an ester

classes.name: Amide reduction
classes.description: Reduction of an amide

superclasses.name: Functional Group Addition (FGA)
superclasses.description: Addition of a functional group to a molecule

classes.name: Hydroxylation
classes.description: Installation of a hydroxyl group (−OH) into an organic compound

classes.name: Halogenation
classes.description: Reaction that introduces one or more halogens into a chemical compound

classes.name: Sulfonation
classes.description: A sulfonic acid group (-SO3H) replaces a hydrogen atom on an aromatic ring

classes.name: Nitration
classes.description: Introduction of a nitro group (-NO2) into a molecule, typically by replacing a hydrogen atom

classes.name: Carboxylation
classes.description: Reaction where carbon dioxide (CO2) is incorporated into an organic molecule, typically resulting in the formation of a carboxylic acid group (-COOH) or a similar functional group

classes.name: Pyridine synthesis
classes.description: Synthesis of pyridine (C5H5N)

classes.name: Indole synthesis
classes.description: Synthesis of indole (C8H7N)

classes.name: Pyrrole synthesis
classes.description: Synthesis of pyrrole (C4H5N)

classes.name: Furan synthesis
classes.description: Synthesis of furan (C4H4O)

classes.name: Thiophene synthesis
classes.description: Synthesis of thiophene (C4H4S)

classes.name: Oxazole synthesis
classes.description: Synthesis of oxazole (C4H5N)

superclasses.name: Protections
superclasses.description: Addition of a protecting group to a molecule

classes.name: Alcohol protection
classes.description: Addition of a protecting group to an alcohol

classes.name: Amine protection
classes.description: Addition of a protecting group to an amine

classes.name: Carbonyl protection
classes.description: Addition of a protecting group to a carbonyl group

classes.name: Carboxylic acid protection
classes.description: Addition of a protecting group to a carboxylic acid

classes.name: Thiol protection
classes.description: Addition of a protecting group to a thiol

classes.name: Alcohol oxidation
classes.description: Oxidation of alcohols

classes.name: Alkene oxidation
classes.description: Oxidation of alkenes

classes.name: Aldehyde oxidation
classes.description: Oxidation of aldehydes

classes.name: Baeyer-Villiger oxidation
classes.description: Formation of an ester from a ketone or a lactone from a cyclic ketone, using peroxyacids or peroxides as the oxidant

classes.name: Epoxidation
classes.description: Addition of a single oxygen atom across a carbon-carbon double bond, forming an oxirane

classes.name: Sulfide oxidation
classes.description: Oxidation of sulfides

superclasses.name: Resolutions
superclasses.description: Separation of a racemic mixture into its respective enantiomers

classes.name: Crystallization
classes.description: Solid formation from a solution, gas, or liquid, resulting in a highly structured crystal with a well-defined three-dimensional lattice

classes.name: Enzymatic resolution
classes.description: An enzyme preferentially binds one enantiomer and performs a chemical reaction on it

classes.name: Kinetic resolution
classes.description: Selective transformation of one enantiomer of a racemic mixture into a product at a faster rate than the other enantiomer

classes.name: Chiral chromatography
classes.description: Separation of enantiomers of chiral compounds by chromatographic methods

classes.name: Diastereomeric salt formation
classes.description: Formation of a diastereomeric salt when an enantiomerically pure acid or base reacts with a racemic mixture of the complementary acid or base, creating a mixture of diastereomers
